snippet: At RJMetrics, we decided to dedicate a 24-hour period every quarter to working on experimental projects. The new ideas that resulted have reshaped our product plans, our market strategy, and our sense of what is possible.
abstract: At RJMetrics, we decided to dedicate a 24-hour period every quarter to working on experimental projects. The new ideas that resulted have reshaped our product plans, our market strategy, and our sense of what is possible.
lead_paragraph: When you’re running a start-up, there never seem to be enough hours in the day. Besides the obvious toll this takes on your personal well-being, it can also have an impact on the health of your business. Overextended teams often spend too much time on triage, which steals time from innovation and out-of-the-box thinking.

headline.main: How We Use ‘Hackathons’ to Generate Big Ideas
